item.title: Announcing the final group of top VCs to judge the Startup Battlefield 200 Final at TechCrunch Disrupt 2024
item.dc:creator: Isabelle Johannessen, Richard Smith
item.description:
TechCrunch Disrupt 2024 is just a week away. Our beefed-up Startup Battlefield 200 is a major highlight. Two hundred companies have been hand-selected by the TechCrunch editorial staff to grace the expo hall, 20 of which will launch their company for the first time live on our stage. Nail-biting pitches live on the Disrupt Stage, […]

item.title: UK digital ‘end-of-life’ services startup Farewill acquired for $16.8M
item.dc:creator: Paul Sawers
item.description:
Farewill, a U.K.-based end-of-life services provider that offers online tools for writing wills, organizing probate, and arranging cremation, has been acquired by funeral service provider Dignity in an all-shares deal valuing the startup at £12.9 million ($16.8 million). The deal is a classic case of an established legacy incumbent chasing growth by buying a younger […]

item.title: From Elon Musk to cop car chases, how a software engineer launched a police AI startup
item.dc:creator: Margaux MacColl
item.description:
Abel creates AI that uses body cam footage and other data to fill out consuming police reports. For research, founder Daniel Francis shadowed the police.

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Can AI make us feel less alone? The founder of Manifest thinks so
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description:
Amy Wu, founder of the AI-based mental health app Manifest, has a bold prediction for the next wave of tech. “Separately from the AI trend, I think so many people are seeing this loneliness epidemic that’s happening with Gen Z,” she said. “There is no doubt in my mind that there will be unicorns that […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Eclipse opens an NYC office with plans to bolster its presence on the East Coast
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Szkutak
item.description:
After nearly a decade, industrials-focused VC Eclipse expanded out of Silicon Valley. The firm opened its second office in New York’s Soho neighborhood with plans to invest more on the East Coast. Eclipse backs startups in sectors including manufacturing, supply chain, healthcare, and infrastructure, among others, both through its early stage and early growth-focused funds. […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Permira completes Squarespace acquisition after upping bid to $7.2B
item.dc:creator: Paul Sawers
item.description:
Website builder Squarespace is no longer a publicly-traded company, after private equity firm Permira procured all remaining common stock in the firm. Permira first revealed plans to acquire Squarespace back in May, offering shareholders in the NYSE-traded company $44 per share — this equated to an equity valuation of $6.6 billion, and an enterprise valuation […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: India’s central bank orders Sachin Bansal’s Navi to halt loans
item.dc:creator: Manish Singh
item.description:
India’s central bank ordered four non-bank lenders, including Navi Finserv and DMI Finance, to halt loans from October 21, citing excessive interest rates and regulatory breaches. The Reserve Bank of India said (PDF) the firms violated rules on pricing, income assessment, and asset classification. This action follows months of warnings about responsible lending practices, it […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Elon Musk’s X boosts DSA info for EU users as bloc’s probe of its complaint handling continues
item.dc:creator: Natasha Lomas
item.description:
An incoming privacy policy update to Elon Musk-owned X (formerly Twitter) will see the company making it clearer to users in the European Union that they have the right to appeal decisions under the bloc’s Digital Services Act (DSA), such as account bans, content takedowns and shadowbanning. The online governance regulation, which applies on scores […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Casio says ‘no prospect of recovery yet’ after ransomware attack
item.dc:creator: Carly Page
item.description:
The Japanese electronics giant says some of its systems remain "unusable" almost two weeks after cyberattack.

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Instagram rolls out new safety features to protect teens from sextortion
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description:
Instagram is introducing a series of new safety features to protect users from sextortion scammers, the company announced on Thursday. Most notably, the company is no longer going to allow people to screenshot or screen record ephemeral images or videos sent in private messages. Up until now, you have been able to screenshot ephemeral content […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Cyera acquires Trail Security for $162M; Cyera is now raising at a $3B valuation
item.dc:creator: Ingrid Lunden
item.description:
Cyera, the Israel-founded, U.S.-based cybersecurity unicorn that uses artificial intelligence to build what’s known as data security posture management — a full assessment and picture of where a customers’ data has been created, where it is stored, and how it is used — has been on a growth tear in the last year, picking up […]

item.title: Zepto eyes $100M from Indian offices in third funding in 6 months
item.dc:creator: Manish Singh
item.description:
Zepto is in advanced stages of talks to raise $100 million in new investment, its third in the last six months, as the leading Indian quick commerce startup looks to rope in more domestic investors, sources familiar with the talks told TechCrunch. The Mumbai-headquartered startup, which delivers grocery items and office stationery to customers’ doorsteps […]

item.title: Accel eyes stake in India’s Truemeds at $330 million valuation
item.dc:creator: Manish Singh
item.description:
According to half a dozen sources, Accel, the global venture firm, is in advanced discussions to lead a funding round of $30 million to $40 million in Truemeds, an Indian online pharmacy that’s focused on providing customers with more affordable generic alternatives to costly branded medications. The talks are currently centered on a proposed valuation […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Meta lays off employees across multiple teams
item.dc:creator: Maxwell Zeff
item.description:
Multiple teams at Meta were hit by layoffs on Wednesday, the company confirmed in a statement to TechCrunch, noting these changes were made to reallocate resources within the company.  “Today, a few teams at Meta are making changes to ensure resources are aligned with their long-term strategic goals and location strategy,” said a Meta spokesperson […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Meta’s AI chief says world models are key to ‘human-level AI’ — but it might be 10 years out
item.dc:creator: Maxwell Zeff
item.description:
Are today’s AI models truly remembering, thinking, planning, and reasoning, just like a human brain would? Some AI labs would have you believe they are, but according to Meta’s chief AI scientist Yann LeCun, the answer is no. He thinks we could get there in a decade or so, however, by pursuing a new method […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: ODD taps $27M for diamond chips to clear radioactive debris at Fukushima Daiichi Nuclear Power Plant
item.dc:creator: Kate Park
item.description:
Back in 2011, the world held its breath after the Fukushima Daiichi nuclear plant in Japan suffered a failure of its cooling systems, in the wake of the country getting hit by a 9.0 magnitude earthquake and tsunami. The worry was not unfounded: the resulting meltdown — which spread highly radioactive material in multiple directions […]

item.title: Apple reportedly worked with a Chinese automaker to develop a battery for its now-canceled car
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description:
Apple worked with a Chinese automaker for years to design a battery system for its now-canceled car project. That’s according to Bloomberg, which reports that Apple was collaborating with BYD Co., a Shenzhen-based car company, to develop batteries using lithium iron phosphate (LFP) cells. Apple contributed engineering expertise, specifically in areas like heat management and […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: The Analogue 3D drags the fondly remembered N64 into the 21st century
item.dc:creator: Devin Coldewey
item.description:
Who among us (and by “us” I mean elder millennials) does not remember the glory days of Goldeneye deathmatches after school? It’s one experience that has been difficult to reproduce despite the march of technology — but retro gaming hardware outfit Analogue’s latest, a ground-up recreation of the N64 called the 3D, will likely be […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: OroraTech’s space-based wildfire detection brings in $25M to put more imaging satellites in orbit
item.dc:creator: Devin Coldewey
item.description:
Wildfires aren’t going away, but our ability to detect and track them — and maybe catch them early enough to prevent serious damage — is getting better. OroraTech is taking a space-based approach to “wildfire intelligence,” and just raised $25 million to grow its market and cover more of the Earth. The German startup currently […]

item.title: SpaceX sues California agency, alleging political bias against Musk and regulatory overreach
item.dc:creator: Aria Alamalhodaei
item.description:
SpaceX has filed a lawsuit against a California agency this week after the body rejected a proposal to increase the company’s launches from the state’s coastline to 50 per year.  The California Coastal Commission (CCC) made its decision at an October 10 meeting, despite the U.S. Air Force endorsing the plan on the grounds that […]
